summary: This is an email chain from July 2020 regarding scheduling the initial appearance and bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell. The correspondence includes a forwarded voice message from the Department of Justice and shows coordination between legal parties to manage public and media inquiries about the hearing date.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge who is to schedule the initial appearance and bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the legal proceedings, for whom an initial appearance and bail hearing is being scheduled.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is the presiding judge over Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal case, responsible for scheduling her court appearances.

events.title: Scheduled Initial Appearance and Bail Hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A request is made to schedule Ghislaine Maxwell's initial appearance and bail hearing for Friday, July 10, 2020.

keyFacts: The document is a July 2020 email chain coordinating the scheduling of Ghislaine Maxwell's initial court appearance and bail hearing.
A specific request was made to schedule the hearing for Friday, July 10, 2020, before Judge Nathan.
The correspondence indicates the legal team was 'inundated with inquiries' about the bail hearing, showing significant public and media interest.
A voice message from the Department of Justice (from a .doj.gov email) was forwarded as part of the communication chain.
